NOTICE_DATA.ORIGINAL_CPV: Renting or leasing services of own property

SHORT_DESCR.P: Hamarøy municipality, hereafter called the contracting authority, invites tenderers to an open tender contest for the rent or procurement of a blue lights building.
Tenders shall therefore cover 2 alternatives (rent or procurement) and the Contracting Authority will choose one of the alternatives.

Note: Parts of the documentation are not public and those who would like access to the tender documentation must, therefore, sign a confidentiality declaration. Requests for the tender documentation are to be sent to rolf.berg@innkjopsservice.no

Hamarøy municipality, hereafter called the Contracting Authority, invites tenderers to an open tender contest for the rent or procurement of a blue lights building (hereafter also called the building).

The tenderer (the lessor) shall, at their own expense, erect a blue lights building on a municipal site at Innhavet in Hamarøy municipality, in accordance with the requirements in the tender documentation. The Contracting Authority will be able to choose to rent or procure the building, cf. more on this below.
Tenders shall therefore cover 2 alternatives (rent or procurement) and the Contracting Authority will choose one of the alternatives.

The blue lights building shall be completed and ready for use by 31.12.2019. If it is not ready by the deadline, there will be a day fine of 5 000 NOK per weekday until the building is ready to be moved into. The day fine will be limited to 10% of the contract value and if this is reached, the municipality can cancel the contract and/or demand compensation.
See the tender documentation for further information.
A site inspection will be held for this competition on 3.5.2018 at 12:00. Meet at Hamarøy hotel. The contact person for the site inspection is Torbjørn Bjørklund tel. 976 52887
Tenderers who would like to participate in the site inspection must register by 27.4.2018, 15:00 to the email address tb@bmcconsulting.no

INFO_ADD.P: See the tender documentation for further information.

SUITABILITY.P: The tenderer shall be a legally established company and registered in a trade register or other company register, e.g. the Brønnøysund Register Centre.
Company registration certificate: confirmation of registration in a company register.
Foreign companies: certificate of registration in a trade register or other company register as described in the law in the country where the tenderer and/or his subcontractor is established.

ECONOMIC_FINANCIAL_INFO.P: The tenderer shall have his tax and VAT payments in order.
Certificate from the chief municipal treasurer (tax, advance payment, garnishments, employer's contributions).
Certificate from the tax collector in the relevant county (VAT).

Foreign companies: Certificate issued by the relevant authority in the tenderer's country that confirms that the tenderer has fulfilled his obligations regarding the payment of duties in accordance with the legal provisions in his home country.
The tenderer shall have sufficient economic and financial capacity to carry out the assignment.
Auditor approved accounts with the reports for the last 2 years. If a tenderer has further information that ought to be taken into consideration, this is to be enclosed.
The company’s most recent Annual Report as well as description of any conditions from the current financial year which are of importance for the accounting figures.
Credit rating / rating, not older than 6 months, carried out by a publicly certified credit rating institution.

Newly started companies that cannot comply with the above, must enclose a binding guarantee statement from a parent company / owner that covers all the financial contract obligations of the contractor, up to and including the guarantee period. The guarantor must also fulfil the requirements for financial capacity and documentation of this must be enclosed with the tender.

TECHNICAL_PROFESSIONAL_INFO.P: Tenderers shall meet the requirements of Norwegian legislation with regard to health, safety and the environment.
HSE self-declaration in accordance with the current regulations, cf. Annex 1.
The self-declaration must not be more than 3 years old at the time the tender deadline expires.

Tenderers must have the professional competence required for carrying out the assignment, as well as experience from projects of an equivalent nature, complexity and extent (contract costs of at least 30 000 000 NOK).
A description of the tenderer's technical personnel or technical entities the tenderer has at their disposal to fulfil the contract.
An overview of equivalent works that have been carried out in the last 5 years. The contract cost must be given.

Certificates from previous Contracting Authorities that show satisfactory execution of the most important works. The certificates shall state the work's value / contract cost, as well as the date and place of execution.

Manpower for this assignment (organisation chart) with names and CVs for key persons who will carry out the assignment. The manpower plan is binding for this project. Certificates are to be presented for the project manager (PL), construction manager (BL) and engineering design manager (PGL). Each person is to present a minimum of 1 testimonial, maximum 3 testimonials from equivalent projects in the last 5 years. The testimonials should state the value, time frame and place the work was performed and indicate whether the works were professionally and properly completed. A reference person who can be contacted shall be given. The testimonials shall be signed by the person responsible for the assignment at the builders.

INFO_ADD.P: See the tender documentation for further information.
